Race.SpecificTitle: Chief of Police -- Town of Haughton
PW Health Units -- .82 Mills - PJ - 10 Yrs.
Race.FullText: Shall the Parish of Bossier, State of Louisiana (the "Parish"), continue to levy an eighty-two hundredths (.82) mills tax on all property subject to taxation in said Parish (an estimated $802,200 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2018 and ending with the year 2027, for the purpose of constructing, equipping and maintaining the services of the Parish health units in said Parish?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW Roads & Bridges -- 1.99 Mills - PJ - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Roads and Bridges Proposition
(Millage Renewal)
Race.FullText: Shall the Parish of Bossier, State of Louisiana (the "Parish"), continue to levy a one and ninety-nine hundredths (1.99) mills tax on all property subject to taxation in said Parish (an estimated $1,947,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2018 and ending with the year 2027, for the purpose of building, constructing, repairing and maintaining roads and bridges in said Parish under a parish wide unit system?

Race.SpecificTitle: Town of Benton -- 4.96 Mills - Mayor & BOA - 10 Yrs.
Race.FullText: Shall the Town of Benton, State of Louisiana (the "Town"), continue to levy and collect a special tax of four and ninety-six hundredths (4.96) mills and collect on all property subject to taxation in said Town (an estimated $48,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2016 and ending with the year 2025, for the purpose of maintaining the streets of said Town?

Race.SpecificTitle: South Bossier Parish Fire Dist. No. 2 -- 13.78 Mills - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
South Bossier Parish Fire District No. 2 Proposition
(Millage Continuation)
Race.FullText: Shall South Bossier Parish Fire District No. 2 of the Parish of Bossier, State of Louisiana (the "District"), levy a thirteen and seventy-eight hundredths (13.78) mills tax on all property subject to taxation in the District (an estimated $1,876,500 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2018 and ending with the year 2027, inclusive, for the purpose of acquiring, improving, operating and maintaining fire protection facilities and equipment in the District; said millage to represent a two and twenty-nine hundredths mills (2.29) increase over the 11.49 mills tax authorized to be levied through the year 2017 pursuant to an election held on May 5, 2007?
